utterances.speaker: PETER DOOCY, FOX NEWS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: There are 15,000 migrants under the Del Rio bridge Saturday. If you add up the ones that you say were expelled or released, it's less than 5,000. Say there's 5,000 that is still left, where's everybody else?

utterances.speaker: JEN PSAKI, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.sentences: I'm happy to get you a more fruitful rundown for you if you -- if helpful from the Department of Homeland Security.

utterances.speaker: PSAKI
utterances.sentences: We feel those images are horrible and horrific. There is an investigation the president certainly supports overseen by the Department of Homeland Security which he has conveyed will happen quickly. I can also convey to you that the secretary also conveyed to civil rights leaders earlier this morning that we would no longer be using horses in Del Rio.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Why isn't the president telling people himself? These images that people say looked like slavery are wrong.

utterances.speaker: PSAKI
utterances.sentences: I think people should take away that his actions made clear how horrible and horrific he thinks these images are.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: I'd like to show you another video if we could, where we saw actually one man start to be swept down the river. He was clearly not a good swimmer. Several Haitian migrants went in after him to try and help him. But ultimately, it was the border patrol, several agents on the other side of the river, who took a line, threw it into the river and they were ultimately able to help that man, that migrant get out of the water.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: It didn't suggest that long rope.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I mean, I don't know. That looks like a relic of slavery right there, huh? So, anyway, Dana, you have horrific images going on for months, total chaos at the border. And what does the White House do? Ban horses. Problem solved.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: This is, it's actually one of the maddening things I've ever seen. So, they misunderstood an image. They overreacted to it. And in order to back fill and cover themselves, instead of saying, well, sorry, we didn't mean to impugn the border patrol. They said, actually we're going to take away your best resource. They don't understand that it's the best resource down there because they are so coddled and sheltered. They can't go to the border.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They never seen it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They have border privilege. You have New York reporters who have no idea why the horses are there because you have rough uneven terrain.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I mean, I even know how to turn a horse like that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I mean, you don't -- you use it as a tool. And these horses are such a resource. Right? And so now all of a sudden, these guys, they're being benched.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They have to have desk duty. They can't even go out there and do their job that they've been trained to do. It really makes me mad.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Let's say Dana was wearing some nice perfume.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Geez.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: When I in here for a sniff like that.

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, FOX NEWS CORRESPONDENT-AT-LARGE
utterances.sentences: Easy. Easy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And that created an image that I was kissing Dana Perino.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I thought that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Fox would fire me or suspend me, or put me on paid leave. Hopefully, paid leave. Over an image that everybody knows is fake? I didn't kiss Dana. I merely sniffed her perfume. That's the same thing they're concerned about an image, not the truth.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: This is --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The truth is so obvious there was no whipping going on. Biden appointed Harris because he needed a buffer to all this. Right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: She did the fake thing. Go find out root causes. She failed. Everything got worse. She comes back, she's like, I'm done. Problem is still there. Now everyone is looking at Joe, right? And they're saying, Joe, what are you going to do? Joe is not going to do anything --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: At worse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- for the next four years. Joe is now saying the system is broken. Joe Broke the system. He got rid of catch and release, the wall. De-cop the ICE people. No more deportations. He broke it. His policy is catch and release. By the way, Joe Biden is the system.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He's been in the system for 40 years. He was V.P. for eight. He can, at the stroke of his pen, get rid of all this and fix it, but he's not. Where did all the money go to Haiti, Geraldo? We talked about this yesterday. In 2010, since then we've given Haiti five billion. Didn't go to the Haitians, Geraldo. It went to people who we greased, OK? Does Joe care? Joe doesn't even care about that. Mayorkas says the border is closed, Katie. OK. Well, it's not closed if you let half the people in that you catch. That's like if you and I went to a party --

utterances.speaker: KATIE PAVLICH, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- and the bouncer says, party is over, and then let us in. Party is not over. Party is just getting started, Katie. So that makes no sense. Then Schumer comes out, lets the truth slip. He says, we need migration and we need amnesty because we have a labor shortage in this country. That's what it's about. They need the cheap labor because that's what their donors want. And then crying Chuck wants the votes. It's perfectly clear.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Just don't sniff me.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible) is raising he didn't ask for permission for an allergy today.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The thing is, the one thing that gets me, Katie, is that the White House did not react to the border crisis until they found somebody to punish.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And it was just a white guy on a horse.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Because that is what's acceptable to Maxine Waters and the squad and everybody else.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes. They haven't been paying attention to this crisis for years --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: -- when it comes to their policies until they could blame a law enforcement official doing the job outlined by the Department of Homeland Security using the horse in the way that he was supposed to because nobody else is stopping these illegal migrants from coming across the order who are disobeying orders. I think this comes down to this being an issue of trust. If the Biden White House is willing to change a policy like this and put border patrol agents in even more detrimental situations and set them up to fail more than they were previously, based on a lie, what else are they capable of doing? You know, this was an emotional decision that was driven by hysteria and false narratives on Twitter. That's what happened. And Democrats are constantly turning the good guys, in this case, border patrol, they've done it with the police, into bad guys to satisfy this emotional political agenda that they have. And it's very obvious to see where they're going because they need a distraction from this real crisis, catastrophe. Right? Al Sharpton was at the border today. Why do you think that Maxine Waters had this -- this press conference? Because they want to make this about race. Because when they make it about race, you are not allowed to talk about it anymore.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: You can't talk about the failed policies. Can't talk about how they're not doing their job. Can't talk about the threat to American communities from not testing for COVID or for, I don't know, criminals who were taking over buses and injuring our ICE officers. Right? And so, you know, next week DHS is going to release their investigation into these -- these border patrol agents who were doing their job. It sounds a whole lot like the White House wants them to be punished.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: And if you just look at what Jen Psaki said. She said we feel those images are horrible and horrific. We feel they are.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: So again, not about facts. Not about what's going on in the ground. Not about solving the problem. It's all about giving into this emotional narrative which means just going to get worse.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, Geraldo, Republicans get a lot of things wrong. There's a lot of --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You (Inaudible) being love me is never having to say you're sorry?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I want a hug. But you know, Republicans have flaws. But there's a big flaw with Democrats. And I was wondering if you would agree with me on this, that they always pit order and process on the opposite end of compassion. So that if you -- if you desire any kind of process or order, somehow you are cold and nonempathetic. And so, what you end up here isn't the ultimate result, it's chaos, where people actually get hurt. Does that make sense?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I guess it does. But I still am horrified by that image. And I hate to say that. I know that it is not the substantive, you know, heart of this matter. But I worry that because of the horse and because of the image is so vivid, we aren't concentrating on what this is about. This is about Haiti. Haiti has gone to hell in a hand basket since the earthquake of 2010 where I was -- I watched Hillary Clinton and absolutely misunderstand what was going on in Haiti there on the runway in Port-au- Prince. You know, these folks have been screwed by the immigration system for generations. Cubans getting most favored nation. Cubans touches the sand in Florida, they get asylum. Haitians touched the sand in Florida they get the bombs rushed. We really need to understand and I believe there is a huge hysterical overreaction to these Haitians. You talk as if there's been this like this ink stain sweeping across the country.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No one talks about that, Geraldo. We're looking at the shanty town, the camp at the gate of the country.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: The camp is almost gone already.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's your image. It has nothing to do with the color of their skin. That's the image that's shocking people, not the guy on horseback.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: That image is -- first of all, --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's also six days later from 15,000.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Right. This is one third of what it was.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, because two-thirds got let in, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But why -- so what they got let in.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. You just let anybody in. Anybody gets to come here, Geraldo? That's the attitude that Joe Biden has. You did invite that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: There was an army of Haitians --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That attitude. No, I'm not. I'm not talking about (Inaudible) army.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Say it's 15,000 -- say it's 15,000.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Don't put words in my mouth. You're doing exactly what Joe Biden does.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You're so sensitive to me putting words in your mouth.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm so sensitive. I'm about to smell you, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And that will be taken out of context.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And you'll get on paid leave which I'll get behind. I will support you 100 percent.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Only if it's paid.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And then we'll pretend like you didn't exist.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I deserve pay.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Ouch.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Up next, the media looking like fools after mocking concerns about violent crime.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: The silly narrative about our city is calling them anarchists, is preposterous to me. As you know, image after image on Instagram yesterday in Central Park, and all over New York with people walking their dogs, like this doesn't seem like anarchy to me.

utterances.speaker: DON LEMON, HOST, CNN
utterances.sentences: Democratic cities are in chaos right now. Crime is rising.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS CUOMO, HOST, CNN
utterances.sentences: Defund police.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: My gosh, it's so bad. And they get, defunding police.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No. Those are two dumb people talking to each other. It's really kind of adorable. You know? The media is better than the mob at burying bodies. They claimed, NBC claimed that crime is going down by taking numbers of different crimes, putting them together so that --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Conflating them

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Conflating them. Yes. Hiding the rising homicide numbers. So, they literally did bury the bodies. Imagine if you did that with COVID or sex abuse or police brutality. And what's weird about this, this isn't government corruption. This is media corruption. They are on purpose burying these facts because they know that they excuse the violence. They are responsible for egging on the riots. There were two dozen dead from that. And also, what you are seeing refutes the ideology that law and order is somehow another symptom of oppression which they've been pushing. But the last thing, the thing that gets me so pissed off about these people., they spread the lies because they don't live in the neighborhoods. They are not affected. Don Lemon is not affected.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Cuomo is not affected. The Bozos before that in the other clips, they are not affected. They don't live where the death is happening so they can hide it, hiding the homicide rates are not going to affect us.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's going to affect the people who need the policing.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Were you there, Geraldo, in 1960 when they released the first numbers?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I was a junior in high school. I was the star of the football team --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: He was.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- and the wrestling team.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I mean, I have figured out some way to bring it back to Geraldo's news about Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Let's go to high school.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But these numbers are bad. You have a lot of thoughts on it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I have a lot of experience there. And I just want to say in Chris Cuomo's neighborhood defense, I lived on 89th Street, he lived close to me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He is the Hamptons now.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Well, because -- that's because of COVID. But to -- now to the statistics on murder.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: COVID is over.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: This is the biggest example of racism we have ongoing in this country. It's not about the horse and that kind of baloney. It's about the ignoring, intentionally ignoring the fact that this is a murder epidemic centered in the center city. This is an experience going on right now, young black men, the number one cause of death is homicide right now. That's a fact. No one can deny it. This is the civil rights issue of our time. I have said it before here. Black Lives Matter, all these liberal commentators ignore it. Young black men are killing other young black men. That's why the murder statistics are out of control. They are bigger than the wave of violent crime that followed the assassination of Martin Luther King. It is the biggest ever. And it is frightening. And yet, because it is contained, Chicago is the example. Because it's in the south side, you live on the north side of Chicago, you have (Inaudible) up there. You know, northwest. You have a great life. Nice, low crime. All the crimes are down. You live in the south side. You have a war going on.

utterances.speaker: PRINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And do you know who's caught in the crossfire? It's not just the young guys killing each other. Then they get the little 4-year-old, then they get grandma. You know, in the stray shots.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I think it's really deplorable and the fact that the Democrats don't mention it, shame on them, shame on Joe Biden. You know this is happening. This is for real, undeniable.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And it's not just happening in the biggest cities. It's happening all across even in midsized cities. I know you talked about Cleveland before. I've read an article recently about Milwaukee.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: We have 127 murders since --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And then one of the better big -- in one year?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Since January.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And then of course, you have Philly. I know near and dear to your home.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All of these cities are messes. And it's sad because in a year where everybody was chanting Black Lives Matter, black Americans were being killed not by white police officers really, they were being killed by other black Americans.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: True.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So how did the left respond to that? Right? How do they respond? They said defund the police. That makes no sense. They blamed racism. That makes no sense. They emptied the prisons. They made bailing out people easier. That makes no sense. They blame guns. That makes no sense. All these cities have very tough gun laws. So, the question is maybe the goal is not to reduce homicides. Maybe there's a different goal, Dana. And follow me here. Because if all these leaders in these cities are Democrats, why aren't they talking about keeping mothers and fathers together? Why aren't they fixing schools? Why aren't they fighting to keep the jobs from being sent overseas? They're not doing any of that. Instead, what are they're doing? They're making people dependent on government. They're dividing us by race. And through these perverse incentives and all this cash they're handing out, they're keeping everybody on the doll, right? And so, they want more. And they get payoffs, right? So, is that more about political power or is that more about saving black lives? I think we know the answer.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And the Democrats wouldn't even allow the Senate bill to go forward for a debate, which was going to do some police reforms that maybe actually could have done something.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes. Because they want to use it as an issue, to Jesse's point. I think about what the solution to this is, and I think about what the Justice Department is doing now. They announced this big initiative. They're going to track illegal guns. The Trump administration did Operation LeGend. And it was named after four- year-old LeGend Taliferro who was killed by a stray bullet while he's sleeping in his bed. And his mother spoke at the White House to talk about how his murder had gone unsolved. So, when you have a rise in murders, you also have a rise in injustice after of course the murder because that needs police resources to track these criminals down, to prosecute them and to find them. They found the suspect who they believe killed him. But in Cleveland for example, there was a police officer working on Operation LeGend and he was killed as a result of trying to track down two teenagers who were involved in a shooting. And when you see people like Joy Reid who have complained about Gabby Petito and people wanting to know what happened with her and her murder, and saying it's an issue of missing white woman syndrome. Well, last year when crime and murders were going up in the community where she was saying the police should be defunded, she was ignoring the fact that mothers were dealing with their 4-year-old children who were not white getting shot in their beds. And so, you know, their priorities are very clear when it comes to what they say they care about and the actions that they actually take.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's like the nation into a circuit breaker. Stop this. Up next, liberal late-night hosts team up to lecture America about a very important topic, climate change.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, it was not.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Who picked that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The Weather Girls.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I am not a headbanger.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Who doesn't love the Weather Girls?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: It was you, Geraldo. Just admit it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Well, perhaps daunted by Gutfeld's superior ratings, I hate to say this, but he's got them. Liberal late-night hosts putting aside attempts of being funny last night, teaming up to demand action on climate change.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Eight late night shows including this one, are doing climate themed nights. OK? Crisis solved. You're welcome.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: This is the back line of changes of getting wild fires in the west, floods in the east, freezing cold in Texas. Billy Joel is going to have to write an update for 2021 and call it actually we did start the fire.

utterances.speaker: JIMMY KIMMEL, COMEDIAN
utterances.sentences: The pandemic, systemic racism, income inequality, immigration, gun violence. But here's the thing. If we don't address climate change none of those issues will matter at all.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Thanks to climate change, we're looking at a future of no sex and tons of violence.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Not funny.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think they're trying to convince their -- I guess Hollywood --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, the advertisers.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, the advertisers so they don't lose their job. When you look at that picture of them altogether, if you show that, can you show that? It looks -- they look like a class of Disneyland live performers about to do a live play on planet earth. Right? They're like it's like a child's TV show that is insanely nauseating. They've replaced comedy with tragedy. I mean, Kimmel talking about, who wants to go, who wants rifle before they're going to bed? Listen to people lecturing it and hectoring them about how the world is going to end. This is really like a cult. They've replaced George Carlin with George Soros.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But put that picture back up. I want to -- are you jealous that you are not in that picture?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: My God, no.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I am so relieved. Where would I stand?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You could be stand right in front of the --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I would hide behind the solar panel.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: The solar panel. Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Or you could hide --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Is that solar panel made by Uyghurs in China?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. It was probably -- it was probably made in China.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Probably was.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And yet, Katie, you can't deny that the world is hotter and dryer and it has been.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The people are hotter.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: OK. The world is also been hotter and dryer before human beings existed on the planet. You've had very hot parts of the earth. We had oceans over places like Arizona where I'm from where you can find seashell fossil at the top the Grand Canyon. So, yes, the climate does change. Whether you can take billions of dollars and throw it into some Paris climate accord and change the temperature of the earth is I think a very arrogant proposition. But you know, Greg, I just love to be terrified about how I'm going to die right before I go to bed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: It's nightmares of drowning or everything that I want.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: To your point, yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: But do you think (Inaudible) should do something that actually matters like, I don't know, walk around New York City and pick up masks that people have thrown away. You know, I saw that video from the Grand Teton National Park. There's a grizzly bear walking around with a mask in his mouth. So, you know what, maybe do something real.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: That was a fake bear. You missed it. That was a fake bear.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: It's a fake bear.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Just -- the hiker was inside.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But isn't it -- we have seen climate change go from speculation, Dana, to absolute fact in the minds of people based on their politics rather than their science. I find that alarming.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, I do think that in some ways, they're preaching to people who already believe in what they believe. But I think one of the frustrating things is that you actually don't talk about real solutions. And one of those things would be like, you know, it takes -- the carbon footprint of one hour of television is more than two residential families, right? So, there's -- these trade-offs and back and forth -- and there are great innovations that are happening right now. Great stuff on battery technology, really good stuff on carbon capture, things like that. That kind of innovation is what's going to help solve this problem, not telling people basically to not do anything. And then these are nuclear NGOs. What's the other one?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Geothermal?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No. Fusion, fusion, not Fusion GPS -- but that there's a lot of innovation and that's what will actually help solve it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And when you see comedians, do you think that -- do you think performance -- do you think showbiz personalities, can they move the needle?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.sentences: They watch it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Those old guys, they weren't that partisan, and people were influenced by them. Remember, they used to have the telethon, Geraldo? And they used to raise tons of dollars.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Yes. I was on them.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Of course you were on them.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Of course, I was.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's probably your "ONE MORE THING."

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Jerry Lewis.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: How come you're talking climate change without talking China? Excuse me?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: No, I just think it's just a lot of virtue signaling from people who don't live the way that they preach.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Virtue signaling. Fox News alert, new developments in the Gabby Petito case. Let's go to a Laura Ingle right now for the latest. Laura? Oh, that's a mistake. There aren't developments. I was very curious as to what the developments might be --

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Dirty Laundrie.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Dirty Laundrie. Up next, The View's Joy Behar stirring up controversy. Find out who she says is the true victim in the Clinton Lewinsky scandal. And again, I'm sorry that I brought you that false Fox News alert.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Well, the Bill Clinton Monica Lewinsky affair is getting brand new attention thanks to the new FX series Impeachment: American Crime Story where Monica serves as a producer. utterances.sentences: I would submit here that the real victim was the United States of America because -- and Hillary Clinton -- because if you remember. when the debate was going on between Trump and Hillary, Trump brought in all these so-called victims of Clinton's peccadilloes. utterances.speaker: PAVLICH

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think that the fact that the Clintons handled the Monica Lewinsky situation so poorly and so atrociously that it has continued to follow them ever since. This show that she's doing is like one of the first paying jobs, regular job that she's been able to get. They completely ruined her life. And for what? How in the world -- Hillary Clinton was the secretary of state. She ran for president. How could she be the victim here?

utterances.sentences: She was a senator as well.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.sentences: Wow.
